channel.title: OpenCast Feed Engine
channel.description: OpenCast Feed Engine is a lightweight, JSON-driven podcast publishing system that gives creators full control over their RSS feed. Define your show and episodes in a single JSON file, deploy through any modern workflow, and instantly generate a standards-compliant RSS feed for Apple Podcasts, Spotify, and all major podcast apps.
channel.author: Podcast Creator
channel.summary: A flexible, creator-friendly podcast feed system powered by JSON and serverless functions.

episodes.title: Welcome to OpenCast
episodes.description: This introductory episode explains how the OpenCast Feed Engine works, why it was created, and how you can use it to publish your own podcast with full control and zero platform lock-in.
episodes.author: Podcast Creator
episodes.subtitle: A quick introduction to the project
episodes.summary: Learn what OpenCast is and how it empowers creators.

episodes.title: Structuring Your Podcast in JSON
episodes.description: This episode walks through the JSON structure used by OpenCast, including channel metadata, episode fields, artwork, and publication settings.
episodes.author: Podcast Creator
episodes.subtitle: Understanding the JSON schema
episodes.summary: A practical guide to organizing your podcast data.

episodes.title: Behind the Scenes: Serverless RSS Generation
episodes.description: In this bonus episode, we explore how the serverless function transforms JSON into a fully valid RSS feed, and how this approach keeps your workflow simple and scalable.
episodes.author: Podcast Creator
episodes.subtitle: A look at the engine under the hood
episodes.summary: How JSON becomes XML through a serverless function.
